GT.content: Derrida reminds us of his perplexity in DIF re: Heidegger’s distinction btwn finding/retaining the word for Being [on way to language]
GT.linkedContent: Derrida reminds us of his perplexity in DIF re: Heidegger’s distinction btwn finding/retaining the word for Being [on way to language]

R.content: in The Experience of Freedom, Nancy puts to use Heidegger’s Jemeinigkeit, as singularity of time, each time, as other time, also “ipseity of singularity”; Derrida has concerns this risks saving the “I can” of voluntary-conscious-intentional-deciding-I-myself, while acknowledging that Nancy divides it, ruins it, w/ interval or trace of a spacing [see p. 51]
R.linkedContent: in The Experience of Freedom, Nancy puts to use Heidegger’s Jemeinigkeit, as singularity of time, each time, as other time, also “ipseity of singularity”; Derrida has concerns this risks saving the “I can” of voluntary-conscious-intentional-deciding-I-myself, while acknowledging that Nancy divides it, ruins it, w/ interval or trace of a spacing [see p. 51]

FK.content: can Heidegger escape Christian motifs of Schuldigsein, Gewissen, or Bezeugung (attestation)?
FK.linkedContent: can Heidegger escape Christian motifs of Schuldigsein, Gewissen, or Bezeugung (attestation)?

FK.content: khōra is nothing but not nothing in which anxiety of Dasein would still be open to question of Being > immemoriality of a desert
FK.linkedContent: khōra is nothing but not nothing in which anxiety of Dasein would still be open to question of Being > immemoriality of a desert

FK.content: Derrida thinks Justice in relation to a sundering (déliaison), an always-safe, always-to-be-saved possibility of secret of disassociation, rather than bringing-together (Versammlung) re: dikē
FK.linkedContent: Derrida thinks Justice in relation to a sundering (déliaison), an always-safe, always-to-be-saved possibility of secret of disassociation, rather than bringing-together (Versammlung) re: dikē

FK.content: yes, Gestell and “all technical manipulation of human beings” (Machenschaft) are the same, doesn’t exclude or efface differential folds
FK.linkedContent: yes, Gestell and “all technical manipulation of human beings” (Machenschaft) are the same, doesn’t exclude or efface differential folds

FK.content: Derrida wondering how Heidegger can separate heilig from religion & technics
FK.linkedContent: Derrida wondering how Heidegger can separate heilig from religion & technics

H.content: p. anne 32 Derrida forces us to think, finally
H.linkedContent: p. anne 32 Derrida forces us to think, finally

FL.content: don’t confuse Heidegger’s Destruktion w/ “destruction” at heart of Benjamin’s thought, but both sought condition of an authentic tradition & memory
FL.linkedContent: don’t confuse Heidegger’s Destruktion w/ “destruction” at heart of Benjamin’s thought, but both sought condition of an authentic tradition & memory

FL.content: Benjamin’s divine, bloodless violence cannot avoid making us shudder w/ its eery affinity to the final solution (resembles too closely to point of specular fascination) > Benjamin still too Heideggerian, too messianico-Marxist or archeo-eschatological [for Derrida]
FL.linkedContent: Benjamin’s divine, bloodless violence cannot avoid making us shudder w/ its eery affinity to the final solution (resembles too closely to point of specular fascination) > Benjamin still too Heideggerian, too messianico-Marxist or archeo-eschatological [for Derrida]

SPOM.content: despite so many precautions, Heidegger runs risk of reducing justice to juridical-moral rules when he prioritizes gathering to the same over disjunction w/ its cinders
SPOM.linkedContent: despite so many precautions, Heidegger runs risk of reducing justice to juridical-moral rules when he prioritizes gathering to the same over disjunction w/ its cinders

SPOM.content: deconstruction had to put into question the onto-theo, archeo-teleological concept of history in Hegel, Marx, “or even” in the epochal thinking of Heidegger
SPOM.linkedContent: deconstruction had to put into question the onto-theo, archeo-teleological concept of history in Hegel, Marx, “or even” in the epochal thinking of Heidegger

HERP.content: where Derrida is beyond Heidegger’s aim (propos) [acc. Derrida]: in the non synonymy of dissemblance, heterogeneity, disproportion, incommensurability, nonexchange, excess of every measure/symmetry > democracy to-come
HERP.linkedContent: where Derrida is beyond Heidegger’s aim (propos) [acc. Derrida]: in the non synonymy of dissemblance, heterogeneity, disproportion, incommensurability, nonexchange, excess of every measure/symmetry > democracy to-come

HERP.content: irreducible, nonformalizable equivocation/inconsistency in Heidegger’s use of “originary” or “nonoriginary” [from 1933-1955] > nonformalizable character insufficiently thematized—thus the political strategies play out, stop, carry along
HERP.linkedContent: irreducible, nonformalizable equivocation/inconsistency in Heidegger’s use of “originary” or “nonoriginary” [from 1933-1955] > nonformalizable character insufficiently thematized—thus the political strategies play out, stop, carry along

POOF.content: in its very depth the keeping silent of Sein und Zeit never laughs (hear something here re: colloquy btwn Heidegger & Nietzsche) > little room for laughter in Heidegger
POOF.linkedContent: in its very depth the keeping silent of Sein und Zeit never laughs (hear something here re: colloquy btwn Heidegger & Nietzsche) > little room for laughter in Heidegger

POOF.content: as always for Heidegger, the gathering of lógos prevails, even if it accords the tensions of a false note
POOF.linkedContent: as always for Heidegger, the gathering of lógos prevails, even if it accords the tensions of a false note

POOF.content: acc. Heidegger, Christianity is an education of passions, even a psychology, a psychological subjectivity—all post-Aristotelian friendships are Christian, same goes for ‘politics’
POOF.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Christianity is an education of passions, even a psychology, a psychological subjectivity—all post-Aristotelian friendships are Christian, same goes for ‘politics’

POOF.content: is Heidegger’s Zusage (prior to the question) that agency of phileîn which is not yet the eroticized tension of philosophy?
POOF.linkedContent: is Heidegger’s Zusage (prior to the question) that agency of phileîn which is not yet the eroticized tension of philosophy?

POOF.content: Derrida proposes to think a perhaps ‘prior’ to Zusage, arche-originary pledge preceding all questioning, a friendship that could never thrive in gathering (Versammlung), that which accords phília to phúsis to lógos
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida proposes to think a perhaps ‘prior’ to Zusage, arche-originary pledge preceding all questioning, a friendship that could never thrive in gathering (Versammlung), that which accords phília to phúsis to lógos

HASD.content: Heidegger says Plato’s khora fell short of thinking the place (Ort), preparing the way for Cartesian space [Derrida thinks this statement is problematic & reductive]
HASD.linkedContent: Heidegger says Plato’s khora fell short of thinking the place (Ort), preparing the way for Cartesian space [Derrida thinks this statement is problematic & reductive]

HASD.content: but 17 years later, Heidegger says, “[hē khōra] heisst der Ort,” and refers to Plato’s khōrismos as the difference of place (die verschiedene Ortung) btwn Being and beings
HASD.linkedContent: but 17 years later, Heidegger says, “[hē khōra] heisst der Ort,” and refers to Plato’s khōrismos as the difference of place (die verschiedene Ortung) btwn Being and beings

HASD.content: for Heidegger, gathering of Geviert takes place in an indivisible topos, simplicity of point [of sword]: “the place (Ort) gathers toward itself at the greatest height and extremity”
HASD.linkedContent: for Heidegger, gathering of Geviert takes place in an indivisible topos, simplicity of point [of sword]: “the place (Ort) gathers toward itself at the greatest height and extremity”

HASD.content: Derrida remarks on the folds of denial in the conditional mode: if Heidegger were to write a theology
HASD.linkedContent: Derrida remarks on the folds of denial in the conditional mode: if Heidegger were to write a theology

MPM.content: de Man “parodies” Die Sprache spricht w/ Die Sprache verspricht—language promises (itself), no originary Sprechen modalized into promise [would Heidegger protest?] [see S p. 93-4]
MPM.linkedContent: de Man “parodies” Die Sprache spricht w/ Die Sprache verspricht—language promises (itself), no originary Sprechen modalized into promise [would Heidegger protest?] [see S p. 93-4]

MPM.content: no deconstruction w/out calling into question dissociation of thought and technology, no longer able to subscribe to Heidegger’s Die Wissenschaft denkt nicht (science does not think)
MPM.linkedContent: no deconstruction w/out calling into question dissociation of thought and technology, no longer able to subscribe to Heidegger’s Die Wissenschaft denkt nicht (science does not think)

MPM.content: for Heidegger, Socrates is “purest thinker,” did nothing else but place himself in the draft, this is why he wrote nothing
MPM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, Socrates is “purest thinker,” did nothing else but place himself in the draft, this is why he wrote nothing

MPM.content: deconstruction is no longer Heideggerian where he tries to reclaim hierarchy, limit purity by claiming “essence of technology is nothing technology” [or thinking of rhetoricity is not rhetorical]
MPM.linkedContent: deconstruction is no longer Heideggerian where he tries to reclaim hierarchy, limit purity by claiming “essence of technology is nothing technology” [or thinking of rhetoricity is not rhetorical]

MPM.content: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”
MPM.linkedContent: Heidegger protects agains abyssal risk of parasitic contamination, of an an-oppositional differance, thus risk and gravity of saying, “essence of technology is not foreign to technology”

MPM.content: memory w/out anteriority, w/out origin, cannot become a Heideggerian theme
MPM.linkedContent: memory w/out anteriority, w/out origin, cannot become a Heideggerian theme

A.content: Heidegger thinks beyond “vulgar concept of time that privileges now,” Derrida asks: “is there anything other than vulgar time & vulgar death” [see OS]
A.linkedContent: Heidegger thinks beyond “vulgar concept of time that privileges now,” Derrida asks: “is there anything other than vulgar time & vulgar death” [see OS]

A.content: death one of the names of a threat, an aporia, that risks paralyzing ontological, hierarchical, territorial apparatus to which Heidegger lends credit; death, in this sense, names what Heidegger early on called “ruination” [look up]
A.linkedContent: death one of the names of a threat, an aporia, that risks paralyzing ontological, hierarchical, territorial apparatus to which Heidegger lends credit; death, in this sense, names what Heidegger early on called “ruination” [look up]

A.content: Heidegger’s hierarchy, desire to think death properly, division btwn ontic & ontological, imposes pure, rigorous, indivisible borders, borders that are crossed but shouldn't be
A.linkedContent: Heidegger’s hierarchy, desire to think death properly, division btwn ontic & ontological, imposes pure, rigorous, indivisible borders, borders that are crossed but shouldn't be

A.content: Heidegger not interested in revenant or mourning—just death itself, not its figures or experiences of demise (Ableben)
A.linkedContent: Heidegger not interested in revenant or mourning—just death itself, not its figures or experiences of demise (Ableben)

A.content: Derrida’s impossible not the same as Heidegger’s possibility of an impossibility [?]
A.linkedContent: Derrida’s impossible not the same as Heidegger’s possibility of an impossibility [?]

A.content: “turn what is thus at the very heart of the possibility of the existential analysis against the whole apparatus of Being and Time” > death as most ex-propriating, most inauthenticating
A.linkedContent: “turn what is thus at the very heart of the possibility of the existential analysis against the whole apparatus of Being and Time” > death as most ex-propriating, most inauthenticating

A.content: Heidegger dissociates Verfallen from original sin, but still needs distinction btwn authentic/inauthentic > death as “possibility of impossibility” can mean Eigentlichkeit inhabited by Enteignis
A.linkedContent: Heidegger dissociates Verfallen from original sin, but still needs distinction btwn authentic/inauthentic > death as “possibility of impossibility” can mean Eigentlichkeit inhabited by Enteignis

A.content: contaminating contraband remains irreducible [insinuates itself in idiom of existential analysis]
A.linkedContent: contaminating contraband remains irreducible [insinuates itself in idiom of existential analysis]

A.content: Being and Time repeats all motifs of onto-theology it denies
A.linkedContent: Being and Time repeats all motifs of onto-theology it denies

EM.content: Derrida’s attention to system and structure, la réduction du sens, neither restores classical motifs nor erases them > rather, determining possibility du sens on basis of “formal” organization which in itself has no sens: a critique [sic] of phenomenologies (Husserl, Hegel), which aspire for une réduction au sens ——this critique would extend to Heidegger who situates his destruction of metaphysical humanism in hermeneutical question on the meaning or truth of Being
EM.linkedContent: Derrida’s attention to system and structure, la réduction du sens, neither restores classical motifs nor erases them > rather, determining possibility du sens on basis of “formal” organization which in itself has no sens: a critique [sic] of phenomenologies (Husserl, Hegel), which aspire for une réduction au sens ——this critique would extend to Heidegger who situates his destruction of metaphysical humanism in hermeneutical question on the meaning or truth of Being

OS.content: Heidegger does not investigate hidden passageway (le passage dissimulé) that makes problem of presence communicate w/ the problem of the written trace
OS.linkedContent: Heidegger does not investigate hidden passageway (le passage dissimulé) that makes problem of presence communicate w/ the problem of the written trace

OS.content: is [Heidegger’s] authentic/inauthentic, proper/improper still Hegelian, still “vulgar” time
OS.linkedContent: is [Heidegger’s] authentic/inauthentic, proper/improper still Hegelian, still “vulgar” time

OS.content: Derrida doesn’t think Heidegger considers relever in his reading of Hegel’s concept of time
OS.linkedContent: Derrida doesn’t think Heidegger considers relever in his reading of Hegel’s concept of time

OS.content: at certain point, destruction of metaphysics remains w/in, only makes explicit its principles > must examine this necessity via this example [re: time in Kant, Aristotle], & formalize rules
OS.linkedContent: at certain point, destruction of metaphysics remains w/in, only makes explicit its principles > must examine this necessity via this example [re: time in Kant, Aristotle], & formalize rules

OS.content: if Aristotle conceived time in a way not dominated by presence, did Heidegger arrest this possibility in Sein und Zeit, did Kant just make explicit the evaded question [section title] in Physics IV? such making explicit keeps to (se tient) the system de l’éludé
OS.linkedContent: if Aristotle conceived time in a way not dominated by presence, did Heidegger arrest this possibility in Sein und Zeit, did Kant just make explicit the evaded question [section title] in Physics IV? such making explicit keeps to (se tient) the system de l’éludé

OS.content: in analytic of Dasein, Heidegger gives credit to self-presence via proximity, proper
OS.linkedContent: in analytic of Dasein, Heidegger gives credit to self-presence via proximity, proper

OS.content: still Platonism in Heidegger’s Verfallen (into time, Being)? > move from primordial to derivative (time) always metaphysical
OS.linkedContent: still Platonism in Heidegger’s Verfallen (into time, Being)? > move from primordial to derivative (time) always metaphysical

OS.content: almost impossible to distinguish Heidegger’s Anwesenheit from Gegenwärtigkeit: sometimes it is a more original presence, other times it questions Greco-Western philosophical closure; perhaps we need to make thought tremble w/ a Wesen not yet Anwesen
OS.linkedContent: almost impossible to distinguish Heidegger’s Anwesenheit from Gegenwärtigkeit: sometimes it is a more original presence, other times it questions Greco-Western philosophical closure; perhaps we need to make thought tremble w/ a Wesen not yet Anwesen

OS.content: differance as a difference older than Being itself, a still more unthought difference than difference of Being/beings > leads to a writing that exceeds all dialectics, w/out history, cause, absence, presence, archia, telos
OS.linkedContent: differance as a difference older than Being itself, a still more unthought difference than difference of Being/beings > leads to a writing that exceeds all dialectics, w/out history, cause, absence, presence, archia, telos

VP.content: Derrida already wondering if irreducible unity Heidegger attributes to words like “being” calls forth same questions as MOP [i.e. Heidegger still caught in MOP]
VP.linkedContent: Derrida already wondering if irreducible unity Heidegger attributes to words like “being” calls forth same questions as MOP [i.e. Heidegger still caught in MOP]

S.content: why not stand firm and interrogate prescription and proscription? [re: phrase axiomatics of Destruktion, which Heidegger would have refused], axiomatics only suspect in epochal schema
S.linkedContent: why not stand firm and interrogate prescription and proscription? [re: phrase axiomatics of Destruktion, which Heidegger would have refused], axiomatics only suspect in epochal schema

S.content: Derrida has problems w/ Heidegger’s interpretation of khōra in Introduction to Metaphysics
S.linkedContent: Derrida has problems w/ Heidegger’s interpretation of khōra in Introduction to Metaphysics

S.content: acc. Heidegger, essence of technology is not technological; Derrida: what if it is? what is this desire for rigorous non-contamination? > envisage fatal necessity of a contamination
S.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, essence of technology is not technological; Derrida: what if it is? what is this desire for rigorous non-contamination? > envisage fatal necessity of a contamination

S.content: “contamination by technology of the thinkable essence of technology”
S.linkedContent: “contamination by technology of the thinkable essence of technology”

S.content: doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, one Heidegger is not exactly hospitable to, unless (see p. 30) he re-calls the other under the same
S.linkedContent: doubling of “spirit” by use of quotation marks affects it w/ obsessive specter, one Heidegger is not exactly hospitable to, unless (see p. 30) he re-calls the other under the same

S.content: for Heidegger, there’s a resignation of spirit into intelligence (Intelligenz), understanding (Verständigkeit), calculation (Berechnung), mass distribution (massenhafte Verteilung); however, Heidegger, says Derrida, would not agree w/ Derrida’s structure of haunting—would be a resignation to calculating authority: Derrida does not agree w/ imaginary Heidegger
S.linkedContent: for Heidegger, there’s a resignation of spirit into intelligence (Intelligenz), understanding (Verständigkeit), calculation (Berechnung), mass distribution (massenhafte Verteilung); however, Heidegger, says Derrida, would not agree w/ Derrida’s structure of haunting—would be a resignation to calculating authority: Derrida does not agree w/ imaginary Heidegger

S.content: Heidegger would refuse designation “commentary” for ontological statement, Derrida asks if we do anything other than commentary [at moment he goes beyond commentary]
S.linkedContent: Heidegger would refuse designation “commentary” for ontological statement, Derrida asks if we do anything other than commentary [at moment he goes beyond commentary]

S.content: most matutinal in Frühe, of promise, an other birth, other essence, hétérogène à l’origine, foreign to Christianity w/out being opposed to it, even more radically foreign to Platonic metaphysics
S.linkedContent: most matutinal in Frühe, of promise, an other birth, other essence, hétérogène à l’origine, foreign to Christianity w/out being opposed to it, even more radically foreign to Platonic metaphysics

FWT.content: Derrida likes Heidegger’s positioning justice outside law but not its harmony w/ injustice > thinking justice on basis of logos, gathering, accord, Being as presence; for Derrida, harshness of justice—infinite disjunction demands its right, out of joint
FWT.linkedContent: Derrida likes Heidegger’s positioning justice outside law but not its harmony w/ injustice > thinking justice on basis of logos, gathering, accord, Being as presence; for Derrida, harshness of justice—infinite disjunction demands its right, out of joint

FWT.content: Heidegger’s Destruktion has Lutheran origins which Derrida has always been interested in deconstructing, but can one pass through, overstep, this “Christian” landscape?
FWT.linkedContent: Heidegger’s Destruktion has Lutheran origins which Derrida has always been interested in deconstructing, but can one pass through, overstep, this “Christian” landscape?

P.content: does Heidegger escape the metaphysics of Hegel’s Aesthetics in “Truth of the Origin…” —or does he repeat it, going no further than “common representation”?
P.linkedContent: does Heidegger escape the metaphysics of Hegel’s Aesthetics in “Truth of the Origin…” —or does he repeat it, going no further than “common representation”?

POS.content: Derrida is “above all” made possible by Heidegger’s ontological difference (the unthought difference btwn Being and beings), yet Nietzsche is “perhaps” a move beyond the ontotheology of Heidegger, toward a differance no longer in language of West
POS.linkedContent: Derrida is “above all” made possible by Heidegger’s ontological difference (the unthought difference btwn Being and beings), yet Nietzsche is “perhaps” a move beyond the ontotheology of Heidegger, toward a differance no longer in language of West

POS.content: Derrida’s departure from Heideggerian problematic re: concepts origin & fall, departure from proper (Eigen), and the sense that Heidegger defends presence more than anyone
POS.linkedContent: Derrida’s departure from Heideggerian problematic re: concepts origin & fall, departure from proper (Eigen), and the sense that Heidegger defends presence more than anyone

SP.content: [re: Heidegger’s reading of Nietzsche, that he still belongs to history of metaphysics] reading opens internal necessity, a certain dehiscence, but no critical/destructive effect: mais elle en transforme la figure et réinscrit à son tour le geste herméneutique [see pp. 81-3, p. 123]
SP.linkedContent: [re: Heidegger’s reading of Nietzsche, that he still belongs to history of metaphysics] reading opens internal necessity, a certain dehiscence, but no critical/destructive effect: mais elle en transforme la figure et réinscrit à son tour le geste herméneutique [see pp. 81-3, p. 123]

ATIA.content: to “let” something “be” “as such,” you would have to “let be” in your absence, in your death, [thus, for Heidegger, being-toward-death and “as such” constitutive of each other] but is this ever possible? can we let the being be? Nietzsche would say no, that the objective is always caught in the living, in life, in perspective > difference btwn animals, thus an “animal” relation
ATIA.linkedContent: to “let” something “be” “as such,” you would have to “let be” in your absence, in your death, [thus, for Heidegger, being-toward-death and “as such” constitutive of each other] but is this ever possible? can we let the being be? Nietzsche would say no, that the objective is always caught in the living, in life, in perspective > difference btwn animals, thus an “animal” relation

ATIA.content: Derrida’s strategy re: border(s) btwn animal/human: there is no pure and simple “as such”
ATIA.linkedContent: Derrida’s strategy re: border(s) btwn animal/human: there is no pure and simple “as such”

ATIA.content: restructuring (pluralizing/varying) “as such” in relation to animal would upset whole framework of Heideggerian discourse, the ontological difference
ATIA.linkedContent: restructuring (pluralizing/varying) “as such” in relation to animal would upset whole framework of Heideggerian discourse, the ontological difference

DS.content: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort
DS.linkedContent: fatal complicity Artaud reveals: all destructive discourses must inhabit structures they demolish, must shelter indestructible desire for full presence, nondifference: à la fois vie et mort

DS.content: not critiquing Artaud from standpoint of metaphysics, Derrida reveals complicity: Artaud must enclose himself in closure of presence to denounce naive implications w/in difference
DS.linkedContent: not critiquing Artaud from standpoint of metaphysics, Derrida reveals complicity: Artaud must enclose himself in closure of presence to denounce naive implications w/in difference

FS.content: l’écriture est l'issue comme descente hors de soi en soi du sens: métaphore-pour-autrui-en-vuc-d'autrui-ici-bas, métaphore comme possibilité d'autrui ici-bas, métaphore comme métaphysique où l'être doit se cacher si l'on veut que l'autre apparaisse
FS.linkedContent: l’écriture est l'issue comme descente hors de soi en soi du sens: métaphore-pour-autrui-en-vuc-d'autrui-ici-bas, métaphore comme possibilité d'autrui ici-bas, métaphore comme métaphysique où l'être doit se cacher si l'on veut que l'autre apparaisse

DIF.content: [re: differance] Derrida in strict communication w/ Heidegger re: liberating question of Being from domination by present/now—but Heidegger is not exhaustive
DIF.linkedContent: [re: differance] Derrida in strict communication w/ Heidegger re: liberating question of Being from domination by present/now—but Heidegger is not exhaustive

DIF.content: before Heidegger purposely and radically questioned presence, Freud & Nietzsche did so, and, remarkably, they did so via motif of differance [remarkable :)]
DIF.linkedContent: before Heidegger purposely and radically questioned presence, Freud & Nietzsche did so, and, remarkably, they did so via motif of differance [remarkable :)]

DIF.content: differance (is) older than ontological difference: outside epochality of Being (outside epoch): no depth to bottomless chessboard on which Being is put to play
DIF.linkedContent: differance (is) older than ontological difference: outside epochality of Being (outside epoch): no depth to bottomless chessboard on which Being is put to play

DIF.content: is this why Heraclitean play of hen diapheron heautōi, the one differing from itself, in difference w/ itself, is lost like a trace when diapherein is determined as ontological difference?
DIF.linkedContent: is this why Heraclitean play of hen diapheron heautōi, the one differing from itself, in difference w/ itself, is lost like a trace when diapherein is determined as ontological difference?

DIF.content: isn’t the determination of differance as ontico-ontological difference, difference w/in horizon of question of Being, still intrametaphysical effects of differance?
DIF.linkedContent: isn’t the determination of differance as ontico-ontological difference, difference w/in horizon of question of Being, still intrametaphysical effects of differance?

DIF.content: differance would be play of trace which no longer belongs to horizon of Being
DIF.linkedContent: differance would be play of trace which no longer belongs to horizon of Being

DIF.content: a trace that can never appear in phenomenon: trace beyond link btwn ontology & phenomenology > trace erases itself, muffles itself in resonating, like the “a” inscribing its pyramid in differance
DIF.linkedContent: a trace that can never appear in phenomenon: trace beyond link btwn ontology & phenomenology > trace erases itself, muffles itself in resonating, like the “a” inscribing its pyramid in differance

DIF.content: Heidegger: usage (Brauch) has left a trace (Spur) in to khreon (necessity), quickly forgotten in destiny of Being, usage conjoins the dis- (Der Brauch fügt das Un-) > doesn’t dis of differance refer us beyond history of Being, beyond our language, beyond anything that can be named in it?
DIF.linkedContent: Heidegger: usage (Brauch) has left a trace (Spur) in to khreon (necessity), quickly forgotten in destiny of Being, usage conjoins the dis- (Der Brauch fügt das Un-) > doesn’t dis of differance refer us beyond history of Being, beyond our language, beyond anything that can be named in it?

DIF.content: differance not a process of propriation, neither “species” of genus Being nor Ereignis (nor ontological difference): neither appropriation (position), nor expropriation (negation)—it is other
DIF.linkedContent: differance not a process of propriation, neither “species” of genus Being nor Ereignis (nor ontological difference): neither appropriation (position), nor expropriation (negation)—it is other

DIF.content: [Derrida argues for new relation  to unnameable, different from Heidegger’s] “no name” for differance is not ineffable Being which no name could approach (i.e. God), it is play which makes possible nominal effects, the chains of substitutions of names
DIF.linkedContent: [Derrida argues for new relation to unnameable, different from Heidegger’s] “no name” for differance is not ineffable Being which no name could approach (i.e. God), it is play which makes possible nominal effects, the chains of substitutions of names

WAP.content: Derrida’s willingness to link thinking to science not form/function Heidegger gives it
WAP.linkedContent: Derrida’s willingness to link thinking to science not form/function Heidegger gives it

WAP.content: Derrida applies Heidegger’s thought of epochality to the philosophical “age”: from Descartes to Hegel truth is certitude, reassuring foundation of subjectivity > but, Derrida also wonders how this will shed light on regional determinants (political, ideological), and whether this systematic perspective puts to the test or a takes distance from the situation
WAP.linkedContent: Derrida applies Heidegger’s thought of epochality to the philosophical “age”: from Descartes to Hegel truth is certitude, reassuring foundation of subjectivity > but, Derrida also wonders how this will shed light on regional determinants (political, ideological), and whether this systematic perspective puts to the test or a takes distance from the situation

DPi.content: unlike Heidegger, Levinas, Derrida asks question of DP before death > pre-comprehending indubitable separation of state of life from state of death calculated by other, by 3rd party, common sense: the point, blade of knife, instant of passing, stigmē of a point; how could we know this clear-cut, sharp limit?
DPi.linkedContent: unlike Heidegger, Levinas, Derrida asks question of DP before death > pre-comprehending indubitable separation of state of life from state of death calculated by other, by 3rd party, common sense: the point, blade of knife, instant of passing, stigmē of a point; how could we know this clear-cut, sharp limit?

DPi.content: calculable credit granted to word “death” indexed to presuppositions in which “capital punishment” finds its place: where it’s indissociable from murder/suicide
DPi.linkedContent: calculable credit granted to word “death” indexed to presuppositions in which “capital punishment” finds its place: where it’s indissociable from murder/suicide

Gii.content: Derrida proposes “manuscripture" to Heidegger’s handwriting (Handschrift), given that typewriting, which Heidegger will indict, is also a handwriting
Gii.linkedContent: Derrida proposes “manuscripture" to Heidegger’s handwriting (Handschrift), given that typewriting, which Heidegger will indict, is also a handwriting

Gii.content: Heidegger: typewriter “tears (entreisst) writing from the essential realm of the hand” [MOP]
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger: typewriter “tears (entreisst) writing from the essential realm of the hand” [MOP]

Gii.content: machine “degrades” word into means of commerce, offers the advantage, for those who enjoy degradation, of dissimulation > Heidegger: “typewriter makes everyone look the same”
Gii.linkedContent: machine “degrades” word into means of commerce, offers the advantage, for those who enjoy degradation, of dissimulation > Heidegger: “typewriter makes everyone look the same”

Gii.content: logo-phonocentrism in Heidegger: writing declines thought, escapes draft when it enters literature [Derrida briefly directs us to Heidegger’s meditation on chreōn, Brauch, necessity, logos]
Gii.linkedContent: logo-phonocentrism in Heidegger: writing declines thought, escapes draft when it enters literature [Derrida briefly directs us to Heidegger’s meditation on chreōn, Brauch, necessity, logos]

Gii.content: [like pitting Bataille against Bataille (see RGE p. 338n)]  > Derrida only “critiques” Heidegger by doing so from other places in his own text: he writes w/ 2 hands at least (i.e. his text is not homogenous)
Gii.linkedContent: [like pitting Bataille against Bataille (see RGE p. 338n)] > Derrida only “critiques” Heidegger by doing so from other places in his own text: he writes w/ 2 hands at least (i.e. his text is not homogenous)

Gii.content: Ort as point of spear (die Spitze des Speers), first & foremost has power of gathering
Gii.linkedContent: Ort as point of spear (die Spitze des Speers), first & foremost has power of gathering

Gii.content: “everything concurs and conveys toward the point,” site always a site of gathering
Gii.linkedContent: “everything concurs and conveys toward the point,” site always a site of gathering

Gii.content: acc. Heidegger, great poet resists forces of dissemination or dislocation, privilege granted to unicity, value of gathering (indivisibility [?])
Gii.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, great poet resists forces of dissemination or dislocation, privilege granted to unicity, value of gathering (indivisibility [?])

Gii.content: end of text, in French, sometimes chute or envoi [re: whether Heidegger’s gathering has ever taken place]
Gii.linkedContent: end of text, in French, sometimes chute or envoi [re: whether Heidegger’s gathering has ever taken place]

REST.content: Derrida insists on strong necessity of Heidegger’s questions on art in spite of traditionality & symptomatic qualities
REST.linkedContent: Derrida insists on strong necessity of Heidegger’s questions on art in spite of traditionality & symptomatic qualities

REST.content: Derrida goes off, rather fancifully, on Heidegger’s “projection” of the peasant woman, calls the decision many names (i.e. ridiculous), then quasi-admits his story could be a projection
REST.linkedContent: Derrida goes off, rather fancifully, on Heidegger’s “projection” of the peasant woman, calls the decision many names (i.e. ridiculous), then quasi-admits his story could be a projection

REST.content: Heidegger missed the detachability of the step, the possibility of the digressive
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger missed the detachability of the step, the possibility of the digressive

REST.content: a certain type of strict commentary on Heidegger, a restitution of him, becomes obscene, his language is no longer recognizable > thinking otherwise means thinking otherwise than he who attempts to think the remainder “properly”—that is, otherwise than properly
REST.linkedContent: a certain type of strict commentary on Heidegger, a restitution of him, becomes obscene, his language is no longer recognizable > thinking otherwise means thinking otherwise than he who attempts to think the remainder “properly”—that is, otherwise than properly

DST.content: “singularity” not novelty, which is too bound up w/ periodization, or, in the best cases, w/ Heideggerian epochal structures
DST.linkedContent: “singularity” not novelty, which is too bound up w/ periodization, or, in the best cases, w/ Heideggerian epochal structures

DST.content: Derrida’s reservation re: history of Being & its epochs, also re: “configuration”: presupposes too much consistency, too much identifiable collectedness in the figure
DST.linkedContent: Derrida’s reservation re: history of Being & its epochs, also re: “configuration”: presupposes too much consistency, too much identifiable collectedness in the figure

DST.content: Derrida wonders if Heidegger’s insistence on Ort, Erörterung, a unique site of gathering, leaves un-thought désistance or dislocation, which might be thought itself [this torments Derrida’s respect for Heidegger, along w/ Derrida’s insufficient concern re: authentic thought]
DST.linkedContent: Derrida wonders if Heidegger’s insistence on Ort, Erörterung, a unique site of gathering, leaves un-thought désistance or dislocation, which might be thought itself [this torments Derrida’s respect for Heidegger, along w/ Derrida’s insufficient concern re: authentic thought]

DST.content: does Lacoue-Labarthe define a subject from which Heidegger protects himself (and seeks relief [assistance])?
DST.linkedContent: does Lacoue-Labarthe define a subject from which Heidegger protects himself (and seeks relief [assistance])?

DST.content: for Heidegger, opposition btwn inadequate/adequate circumscribed by alētheia’s withdrawal—yet, Lacoue-Labarthe’s mimesis haunts alētheia w/ unstable homoiōsis ——abyss of pre-originary mimesis, “precedes” truth, introduces desire for homoiōsis > Derrida explains how, w/ this thinking, Lacoue-Labarthe dislocates Heidegger’s epochal history
DST.linkedContent: for Heidegger, opposition btwn inadequate/adequate circumscribed by alētheia’s withdrawal—yet, Lacoue-Labarthe’s mimesis haunts alētheia w/ unstable homoiōsis ——abyss of pre-originary mimesis, “precedes” truth, introduces desire for homoiōsis > Derrida explains how, w/ this thinking, Lacoue-Labarthe dislocates Heidegger’s epochal history

DST.content: though Heidegger recalled that Georgiades translated rhuthmos as Gepräge (imprint, seal, type, character), this didn’t prevent him from bringing typos back to ontotypology & subject back to epoch of subjectity
DST.linkedContent: though Heidegger recalled that Georgiades translated rhuthmos as Gepräge (imprint, seal, type, character), this didn’t prevent him from bringing typos back to ontotypology & subject back to epoch of subjectity

PSSS.content: originary affirmation, which advances itself in advance, lends [?] rather than gives itself?
PSSS.linkedContent: originary affirmation, which advances itself in advance, lends [?] rather than gives itself?

PPT.content: Riss: opens above gulf, holds together opposite edges [is Derrida’s trait the same?]
PPT.linkedContent: Riss: opens above gulf, holds together opposite edges [is Derrida’s trait the same?]

LI.content: deconstruction of onto-theological humanism (of Heidegger too) > iterability of mark beyond all human speech acts
LI.linkedContent: deconstruction of onto-theological humanism (of Heidegger too) > iterability of mark beyond all human speech acts

EW.content: Derrida finds Heidegger’s questions about Descartes necessary, but finds the link btwn subjectivity and representation inadequate, as well as the way he links the subject-object couple to Leibniz’s principle reason
EW.linkedContent: Derrida finds Heidegger’s questions about Descartes necessary, but finds the link btwn subjectivity and representation inadequate, as well as the way he links the subject-object couple to Leibniz’s principle reason

EW.content: also, Heidegger’s foreclosure of Spinoza, who critiques finalism and (Cartesian) representative determination of the idea, risks problematizing Heidegger’s theory of the epoch
EW.linkedContent: also, Heidegger’s foreclosure of Spinoza, who critiques finalism and (Cartesian) representative determination of the idea, risks problematizing Heidegger’s theory of the epoch

EW.content: Derrida believes in certain irreversibility of replacing subject w/ Dasein, though Dasein is still too marked by vorhanden, thus time—the ontological structure is insufficiently questioned
EW.linkedContent: Derrida believes in certain irreversibility of replacing subject w/ Dasein, though Dasein is still too marked by vorhanden, thus time—the ontological structure is insufficiently questioned

EW.content: from Heidegger’s being-thrown to  another thinking of destination, chance, destinerrance
EW.linkedContent: from Heidegger’s being-thrown to another thinking of destination, chance, destinerrance

EW.content: since there has to be some calculation, Derrida “never held against calculation that condescending reticence of ‘Heideggerian’ haughtiness”
EW.linkedContent: since there has to be some calculation, Derrida “never held against calculation that condescending reticence of ‘Heideggerian’ haughtiness”

AD.content: Levinas’ welcome contests Heidegger’s motifs of gathering & collecting (colligere)

WOG.content: horizon of Greek thing itself no longer assured in Derrida: neither as place, system of language, spiritual figure (‘Husserl’) or historial figure (‘Heidegger’)
WOG.linkedContent: horizon of Greek thing itself no longer assured in Derrida: neither as place, system of language, spiritual figure (‘Husserl’) or historial figure (‘Heidegger’)

WOG.content: unlike Deleuze and Foucault, Derrida constantly thematized vis-à-vis Heidegger, always a deconstructive explication, always folded-onto itself (sur-pliée): Heidegger’s history of philosophy and of being, Heidegger’s Nietzsche, Aristotle, his situating of Greek language, theos and theion, principle of reason, mimêsis, truth, khōra [each theme has a footnote providing texts where discussed]
WOG.linkedContent: unlike Deleuze and Foucault, Derrida constantly thematized vis-à-vis Heidegger, always a deconstructive explication, always folded-onto itself (sur-pliée): Heidegger’s history of philosophy and of being, Heidegger’s Nietzsche, Aristotle, his situating of Greek language, theos and theion, principle of reason, mimêsis, truth, khōra [each theme has a footnote providing texts where discussed]

WOG.content: margin btwn polysemy & dissemination, an objection to Heidegger & Aristotle
WOG.linkedContent: margin btwn polysemy & dissemination, an objection to Heidegger & Aristotle

WOG.content: Derrida’s Nietzsche different froMm Foucault’s & Deleuze's because of an insistent passage through Heidegger
WOG.linkedContent: Derrida’s Nietzsche different froMm Foucault’s & Deleuze's because of an insistent passage through Heidegger

WOG.content: [Derrida deconstructs his Greek influence by disagreeing w/ Heidegger’s interpretation of logos (as gathering towards the One and the Same)]
WOG.linkedContent: [Derrida deconstructs his Greek influence by disagreeing w/ Heidegger’s interpretation of logos (as gathering towards the One and the Same)]

WOG.content: hen diapheron heautôi (Heraclitus) is Greek heritage Derrida is most faithful to, tries to think this “one differing from itself” alongside (“improbably”) the khōra > the very event of the même, the soi-même: under this sign, Derrida contrasted differance to ontological difference [cf. DIF p. 22]
WOG.linkedContent: hen diapheron heautôi (Heraclitus) is Greek heritage Derrida is most faithful to, tries to think this “one differing from itself” alongside (“improbably”) the khōra > the very event of the même, the soi-même: under this sign, Derrida contrasted differance to ontological difference [cf. DIF p. 22]

WOG.content: “reading of Heidegger has given me to think…in the most abyssal, unforeseeable way” > still, Derrida critiques the following in Heidegger: epochalization of science & technology, animality/hand, sexuality & life, question as originary form or ultimate dignity of thought, reading of Nietzsche, principle of reason, use of khōra, relationship to language (German/Greek), ontological difference, logos as gathering…
WOG.linkedContent: “reading of Heidegger has given me to think…in the most abyssal, unforeseeable way” > still, Derrida critiques the following in Heidegger: epochalization of science & technology, animality/hand, sexuality & life, question as originary form or ultimate dignity of thought, reading of Nietzsche, principle of reason, use of khōra, relationship to language (German/Greek), ontological difference, logos as gathering…

CIN.content: there are cinders only if there is a hearth, some fire or place, cinder as the house of being
CIN.linkedContent: there are cinders only if there is a hearth, some fire or place, cinder as the house of being

BSi.content: Heidegger against strict, conventional division of man/animal [for very different reasons than Derrida], doesn’t make man unique enough
BSi.linkedContent: Heidegger against strict, conventional division of man/animal [for very different reasons than Derrida], doesn’t make man unique enough

OG.content: Heidegger’s reading of Nietzschean demolition irrefutable if it remains confined to metaphysical edifice, entirely other if one accepts the deconstruction at hand > is Nietzsche captive or deconstructive?
OG.linkedContent: Heidegger’s reading of Nietzschean demolition irrefutable if it remains confined to metaphysical edifice, entirely other if one accepts the deconstruction at hand > is Nietzsche captive or deconstructive?

OG.content: Nietzsche contributed great deal to liberating signifier from dependence on logos (in relation to truth, primary signified) > to save Nietzsche from Heidegger’s reading (N. remains simply w/in metaphysics), we need to understand how a step out of metaphysics must still utilize it in a certain way, perhaps we should offer Nietzsche up to Heidegger’s reading entirely
OG.linkedContent: Nietzsche contributed great deal to liberating signifier from dependence on logos (in relation to truth, primary signified) > to save Nietzsche from Heidegger’s reading (N. remains simply w/in metaphysics), we need to understand how a step out of metaphysics must still utilize it in a certain way, perhaps we should offer Nietzsche up to Heidegger’s reading entirely

OG.content: the (transcendental) word “being” as Urwort (mot originaire) ensures “l’être-mot” to all other words [Lacan’s name-of-the-father], but “being” not reduced to word or concept: 1) modern linguistics doesn’t have to do w/ [Heideggerian] “language” 2) question of being [Seinsfrage] enclosed (unknowingly) in old linguistics of word
OG.linkedContent: the (transcendental) word “being” as Urwort (mot originaire) ensures “l’être-mot” to all other words [Lacan’s name-of-the-father], but “being” not reduced to word or concept: 1) modern linguistics doesn’t have to do w/ [Heideggerian] “language” 2) question of being [Seinsfrage] enclosed (unknowingly) in old linguistics of word

OG.content: does Heidegger transgress logocentrism of phonè by questioning being? or does the question precomprehend the word being? deconstructive breakthrough (percée) no longer circumscribed in ontic/ontological [?]
OG.linkedContent: does Heidegger transgress logocentrism of phonè by questioning being? or does the question precomprehend the word being? deconstructive breakthrough (percée) no longer circumscribed in ontic/ontological [?]

OG.content: Heidegger transgresses and contained (y est comprise) at same time in presence of logocentrism > his crossing-out (rature, kreuzweise Durchstreichung) of Being effaces presence of transcendental signified while keeping it legible: this last writing is a first writing (of an epoch), inasmuch as it de-limits onto-theology, metaphysics of presence, logocentrism > Heidegger must restore (provisionally) “transcendence” to Being to renounce project/word ontology [given risk of transgression becoming regression here, Derrida insists we go by way of Heidegger’s rigor alone]
OG.linkedContent: Heidegger transgresses and contained (y est comprise) at same time in presence of logocentrism > his crossing-out (rature, kreuzweise Durchstreichung) of Being effaces presence of transcendental signified while keeping it legible: this last writing is a first writing (of an epoch), inasmuch as it de-limits onto-theology, metaphysics of presence, logocentrism > Heidegger must restore (provisionally) “transcendence” to Being to renounce project/word ontology [given risk of transgression becoming regression here, Derrida insists we go by way of Heidegger’s rigor alone]

OG.content: on (à) but not w/in (en-deçà) Heidegger’s horizon, being no longer transcendental signified but a determined signifying trace, “ontico-ontological” derivative w/ respect to differance
OG.linkedContent: on (à) but not w/in (en-deçà) Heidegger’s horizon, being no longer transcendental signified but a determined signifying trace, “ontico-ontological” derivative w/ respect to differance

OG.content: differance can only be thought by passing through the ontico-ontological difference, a determination that gets erased by differance: this trick of writing (tour d’écriture) is irreducible
OG.linkedContent: differance can only be thought by passing through the ontico-ontological difference, a determination that gets erased by differance: this trick of writing (tour d’écriture) is irreducible

OG.content: “God’s death” & “return to finitude” belong to onto-theology they fight against > differance something other than finitude
OG.linkedContent: “God’s death” & “return to finitude” belong to onto-theology they fight against > differance something other than finitude

OG.content: perhaps Heidegger couldn’t read in Nietzsche the attempt to think differance prior to being (aka presence) > being speaks nothing other than metaphysics: even if thinking its closure
OG.linkedContent: perhaps Heidegger couldn’t read in Nietzsche the attempt to think differance prior to being (aka presence) > being speaks nothing other than metaphysics: even if thinking its closure

EU.content: translating structure begins as soon as a reading of “original” text is instituted, offers up language to be read in its very erasure: erased traces of a path (odos), chemin d’effacement, translation passing over/beyond the path of language [beyond Heidegger], passant son chemin
EU.linkedContent: translating structure begins as soon as a reading of “original” text is instituted, offers up language to be read in its very erasure: erased traces of a path (odos), chemin d’effacement, translation passing over/beyond the path of language [beyond Heidegger], passant son chemin
